Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the scenario's process flow The steps seem sequential Let me outline the typical sequence 1 Idea Generation IG starts the process 2 Then Design Draft DD comes next 3 Technical Feasibility Check TFC after DD The list is IG DD TFC CE PC LT UT AG MP FL

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: each product idea goes through a series of steps implying that all are required Existence All activities must exist in any valid trace So each activity in the list must have existence set to 1.0 exactly_one would have all the activities with 1.0 Because in a process like this each step is done once

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Cost Evaluation CE might be parallel or after TFC The scenario says series of steps so maybe they are sequential But sometimes in manufacturing some steps can be parallel For example after DD TFC and CE could be done in parallel but since the user didn't specify concurrency perhaps assume a linear sequence

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: init is definitely IG since it is the starting point So in the init dictionary IG would have support 1.0 and confidence 1.0 For precedence each activity after IG would have their immediate predecessor So DD must be after IG TFC after DD and so on

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: precedence This is likely a direct precedence constraint meaning activity A must occur before activity B succession might be the opposite for activity A what comes after it So succession would have for IG the next activity is DD

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: for precedence use immediate predecessor approach To be safe in a linear sequence each activity's predecessor is the immediately prior one Similarly for succession each activity except the last has the next as successor

Name: Validation - PE
Text: the structure for precedence is probably a dictionary where for each activity B the keys are the activities A that must precede B That matches the problem's instruction the value is a dictionary containing as keys the activities and as corresponding value the support 1.0 and confidence

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: PC must come after both TFC and CE but if the sequence is TFC then CE then PC so PC's predecessor is CE In that case only CE is a direct predecessor However if parallel then both but since series of steps sequential so only immediate

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For other keys like responded_existence coexistence response since the process is linear and unsure or not needed set to empty dicts All required keys must be present even if empty
